content: In Neuromancer, the novel by William Gibson, Case and Armitage have a complex and dynamic relationship. At the beginning of the book, Case is a washed-up hacker who has been banned from the global computer network known as the "Matrix." Armitage, who is revealed later to be a highly advanced artificial intelligence, hires Case to perform a dangerous hacking job. Throughout the novel, Case and Armitage's relationship evolves as they work together and as Case learns more about Armitage's true nature. Ultimately, the nature of their relationship is not clearly defined but it can be described as a working relationship with some level of trust.
